content: hanami socks ashita - designed by anna-lena trost these socks are inspired by the beauty of cherry blossoms i needed some time to write down my idea of the socks and finally did it when my friend riccarda telling me she had spend some time in japan and also loves cherry blossoms the socks are worked cuff-down after some row of ribbing you start with stranded colorwork the heel is knitted with ribbing and slipped stitches and the gusset is on the sole supplies two colors of sock yarn fingering weight - 100 g 365 m main color - 50 g 180 m contrast color 2 00 mm needles for the cuffs 2 5 mm needles or size needed to obtain the right size like explained in the sizing section stitch markers 40 beads yarn needle abbreviations st s = stitche s bor = beginning of round mc = main color shown as pink in the charts cc = contrast color shown as blue in the charts k = knit k tbl= knit to the back loop p = purl p2tog = purl 2 together k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip 1 stitch knitwise slip 1 stitch knitwise knit 2 together through back loops sl = slip 1 stitch purlwise s2kp2 = slip 2 st knitwise k1 in mc pass over the slipped st rs = right side ws = wrong side gaugeandsizing for size s 7 5 /19 cm circumference 38 stitches and 42 row = 4 x 4 / 10 x 10 cm in stranded colorwork pattern for size m 8 5 /21 5 cm circumference 34 stitches and 40 row = 4 x 4 / 10 x 10 cm in stranded colorwork pattern cuff start the cuff with the long-tail tubular cast-on like shown here https //youtu be/89zoz0fkqg0 using the long-tail tubular cast on cast on 72 sts in mc turn work work one setup row by knitting the stitches that appear like knit stitches and slip the stitches that appear as purl stitches with yarn in front join for working in the round be careful not to twist add a bor marker setup round slip the knit stitches with yarn behind purl the purls now everything is prepared for the cuff with 1x1 ribbing 1x1 ribbing *k1 p1* repeat from * to * to bor work the 1x1 ribbing pattern above for a total of 16 rounds or until desired length hanami-socks © anna-lena trost 2 topofleg switch needles and start following chart a1 use chart a2 for the second sock always holding mc dominant if you want work the pattern with ladder back use the first row to setup the ladder back sts shown as green lines in the pattern this video will help you to set up the ladder back https //youtu be/7_5_-suxbsq from round 3 to 16 you have to insert beats knit with mc than pass the beat on the stitch you just knitted in round 45 decrease the ladder
